title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based e-Learning Course for Traditional Craft Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational understanding of craft skills; possesses digital device proficiency
context.additional_context: Designed as part of a cultural heritage succession project for professionals. Integrated operation of VR simulations and Moodle platforms in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners progressively acquire traditional woodworking techniques through a three-stage scaffolding structure (foundational-applied-comprehensive).
Learners achieve over 80% task accuracy by applying cognitive load management strategies (visual cues, task segmentation) in simulation environments.
Learners self-assess skill application abilities and incorporate feedback at the end of each module via formative assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
